reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Special Accounts Appropriation and Control Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Prescribed Class of Persons and Payment Amount Determination Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 79/2016, March 16, 2016]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Special Accounts Appropriation and Control Act;
adoption director means a director under the Adoption Act;
director means a director under the Child, Family and Community Service Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 9.4 (6) (a) (i) of the Act, a person who meets the following requirements is in a prescribed class of persons:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is born on or after January 1, 2006;
the person is 17 years of age or older but under 36 years of age;
one or more of the following applies to the person while the person is or was a child or youth, as applicable, over a period of at least 12 months:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person was subject to a custody order under Part 3 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act that placed the person in the custody of a director;
a director was the personal guardian of the person under section 51 of the Infants Act;
the person was a party to an agreement made under section 12.2 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determination of amount to be paid to designated person

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 9.4 (6) (a) of the Act, between January 1, 2016 and March 30, 2016 the amount to be paid to a designated person is to be determined once by multiplying

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of children who reached the age of 6, 7, 8 or 9 years in 2015 and who were subject, in that year, to a custody order under Part 3 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act that placed the child in the custody of a director,
the number of children who reached the age of 6, 7, 8 or 9 years in 2015 and for whom, in that year, a director was the personal guardian under section 51 of the Infants Act, and
the number of children who reached the age of 6, 7, 8 or 9 years in 2015 and for whom, in that year, an adoption director was the guardian under section 24 or 75 of the Adoption Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 9.4 (6) (a) of the Act, after January 1, 2017 the amount to be paid to a designated person is to be determined on an annual basis by multiplying

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of children who reached the age of 6 years in the immediately preceding calendar year and who, in that year, were subject to a custody order under Part 3 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act that placed the child in the custody of a director,

the number of children who reached the age of 6 years in the immediately preceding calendar year and for whom, in that year, a director was the personal guardian under section 51 of the Infants Act, and

the number of children who reached the age of 6 years in the immediately preceding calendar year and for whom, in that year, an adoption director was the guardian under section 24 or 75 of the Adoption Act.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Special Accounts Appropriation and Control Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 436, section 9.4]
